subject: Politics
title: Direct vs Representative Democracy
description: A micro-lesson that makes Direct vs Representative Democracy usable.

hook.text: Athens let citizens vote on every law. Modern democracies elect representatives. Which version is more democratic?

buildup.text: Direct democracy means citizens decide issues themselves. Representative democracy means they elect people to decide.

discovery.text: Switzerland uses referendums extensively. Most other democracies rely on elected legislatures for decisions.

twist.text: Direct democracy sounds better but has problems. Voters lack expertise, and majorities can tyrannize minorities.

climax.text: Most modern democracies blend both: elected representatives with referendums on major constitutional questions.

punchline.text: More participation isn't always better. Democracy balances voice with wisdom.

quiz.question: Which country extensively uses direct democracy through referendums?
